comments_since_last_sample.body: DOJ, WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU PLAYING AT.

I became a single Mother of five children, ages 3-12 at the time. They are now grown, responsible, thriving children with families of their own. I attribute this to one main thing I learned from my parents. When a problem arises, you deal with it IMMEDIATELY. Nip it, confront it and take appropriate actions. I watched so many other parents vacillate and issues grew worse. This is no different. As a matter of fact this delay in action is pathetically weak. We should not, as citizens, have to wait and wonder whether DOJ or committee has enough common sense to read the situation correctly and act with the diligence required to achieve the desired outcome of Justice. For the love of God, they need to grow up and do their damn jobs.
Keep the faith please. DoJ needs to do die diligence etc. If the benchmark is 9 days, you should still have like a week of patience.

Thank you very much for your daily contribution. This allows me to follow the situation in the US closely. I watch in disbelief as a democracy implodes due to the inaction of those in charge who do not allow the institutions to function as they should. It is astonishing and above all disappointing. A bad example for all fragile democracies in the world.
Garland looked timid, weak, and intimidated in face of GOP verbal assaults during committee hearings. Strange reaction for such power position.

I had a friend who couldn't understand why my children were so well behaved. I watched her "discipline" her children. She would tell them to stop doing something and they would ignore her and then she would say, "I'm going to count to three. One...two...two and half..." And then she would throw up her hands and say, "I just don't know what's wrong with those kids." This is what Congress is doing. Once you say two and a half, no one takes you seriously anymore.
What can we do??!!
